content: How can I determine the version of scipy installed on my system?

To determine the version of SciPy installed on your system, you can use the following methods:

### Method 1: Using Python Code
1. Open a Python interpreter or a Jupyter Notebook.
2. Run the following code:

   ```python
   import scipy
   print(scipy.__version__)
   ```

This will print the version number of the installed SciPy package.

### Method 2: Using Command Line
1. Open your terminal or command prompt.
2. Run the following command:

   ```bash
   pip show scipy
   ```

This will provide detailed information about the SciPy package, including its version.

### Method 3: Using Conda (if you use Anaconda)
1. Open your terminal or Anaconda prompt.
2. Run the following command:

   ```bash
   conda list scipy
   ```

This will display the version of SciPy installed in your conda environment.

These methods will help you identify the version of SciPy installed on your system.
